communications.communication:
November 7, 2023

submitted via email to "KATHRYN KEMP" <kkemp@bethelsd.org>

Hello,

I don't understand your "communication informing you of our need for an
extension" including "clarification."

Here is the original request:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Bethel School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

I do not know how to make this request more clear. 

You have closed the request, opened the request, delayed the request, closed, opened, and then requested commercial purpose forms. You have demanded fees that do not seem to be based on actual agency costs and then ignored my inquiries about actual agency costs.  I too am quite confused as to where you are now with this request, however when we get to the end I will count up the entire production installments and if in sum total they match:

"a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Bethel School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021."

GREAT!

if not,

PROBLEM.

That should answer all the questions you could ever have about this request.

Thank you.

-Please get back to me with an answer about my email of 10-11-23 questions about actual agency costs.

communications.subject: Re: [FOIA] Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: OPPL FOIA Logs 3_2024
communications.communication:
Dear Niles Coalition,

I attached the FOIA log that you requested. Your request is granted in part
and denied in part. Certain information was redacted or withheld pursuant
to the below FOIA exemptions. The last names of FOIA requestors (who are
not news media but citizens/residents) are redacted pursuant to Section
7(1)(c) of FOIA.

In the first log that you requested I made an error recording the date, it
should have been 2024, not 2023. I requested an extension because I was out
of town at a library conference and did not have access to my files. I
appreciate your diligence and if you have any questions or concerns, please
let me know.

Suzy

Suzanne Wulf, (she/her), Co-Interim Director

Oak Park Public Library | 834 Lake St. | Oak Park, IL 60301

swulf@oppl.org | p 708.452.3410 | oppl.org <https://www.oppl.org/>
--

title: State Police Agency FOI Request Log (2018 - 2023) (Washington State Patrol)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: State Police Agency FOI Request Log (2018 - 2023) (Washington State Patrol)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, this is a request for records related to this agency’s receipt of and response to public records requests. 

For the period from January 1, 2018 through December 31, 2023, please provide all logs and available related details of public records requests received by this office. Responsive materials include those that describe the following details for each public records request received by this office: 
The name of the requester and the affiliated organization
The date on which the request was received by this office
A description of the requested records
The tracking number assigned by this office to the request
